name: Livestock
intro: Zakat on livestock is due on camels, cattle, sheep, and goats that are grazed and reach the nisab for a full lunar year. It is a means of purifying wealth and supporting the needy.

evidences.text: ...and give its due [zakah] on the day of its harvest...
There is no zakat on less than five camels...

conditions: Owns livestock above the nisab for one lunar year (hawl).
Animals are grazed freely most of the year.
calculation: Zakat is due if you own: 5+ camels, 30+ cattle, or 40+ sheep/goats. The amount varies by number and type.
example: Example: You own 50 sheep. Zakat due: 1 sheep. See detailed tables for other animals.
madhhabNotes: All schools: Zakat is due on freely-grazed livestock above nisab. Amount varies by type and number.

faq.q: What is the nisab for sheep?
Is zakat due on animals fed with bought fodder?
faq.a: No, only on freely-grazed animals. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/145951/the-nisaab-for-zakaah-on-sheep-and-goats
